abstract: College Basketball Notebook; Indiana's new law allowing businesses to refuse service to same-sex couples poses problem for NCAA, which must now decide whether to hold events in Indianapolis, city scheduled to host final four round of men's basketball tournament.
lead_paragraph: A new law in Indiana allowing businesses to refuse service to same-sex couples may force sports officials to evaluate whether to hold major events in Indianapolis, which is hosting the Final Four next week.

headline.main: Controversial Indiana Law Puts Pressure on N.C.A.A. and Other Leagues
headline.print_headline: Indiana Law Creates Quandary for N.C.A.A.

snippet: A new law in Indiana allowing businesses to refuse service to same-sex couples may force sports officials to evaluate whether to hold major events in Indianapolis, which is hosting the Final Four next week.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
